intro: Xanthisma blephariphylla, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low, sprawling growth habit and pale green to yellowish foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in early spring. Xanthisma blephariphylla is adapted to harsh desert conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor, sandy soils. It plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
